title: Ya know what I don't get about people complaining about Zed?
body: People actually complain about zed when he's the fairest of any assassin and actually requires skill to do his job whereas stuff like Talon and Rengar just dump their load on your face without having to put any thought into it.

The problem is that supposed "outplay" champions have "outplay mechanics" which give them a significant outplay advantage. It is such that they will have a response to just about anything a champion with a less overloaded kit can throw at them, and it comes to feel like you cannot outplay them unless *they* are the ones to outplay themselves by making stupid mistakes. This makes them feel unfair, rather than feel like they actually outskill you.

I mean
He can press R E and One Auto and kill someone late game
Another broken part is how in lane he can harass you from so far away, and when you walk up, he can WEQAuto for 1/3-2/3 of your hp

Two reasons.

1: Zed has range.  A lot of range... making it hard to feel safe from him.  Rengo has to ult to get on you unless you facecheck a bush he's in and the game telegraphs that he's coming. HARD.  Talon has to walk up into your grill or flip a wall and land next to you.  Sure, he can do it while his ult is up, but again... telegraphed as hell.  Zed can shadow-swap in and ult you from almost a screen away, mash all his keys, and kill you.  There's counterplay to his ult, yeah... but his long-range dive in is brutal, and he can toss his Q from across the screen through his shadows.  Zed doesn't feel like he suffers the downsides of a melee champ, and even ranged champs have to play against him as if he's Xerath or something with all the long-ranged poke he can toss at you... let alone his hard all-in if he chooses to.  This makes him hard to deal with unless you can deal with both poke AND all-in...  Most mages and squishy mids do one or the other.

2: Zed is safe.  He can shadow-swap away from dangers with ease.  He can abort a failed dive with one button and save himself from death by his own mistakes.  He's near impossible to pin down.  I see him almost like AD LeBlanc.  Not worth ganking unless he's gone in hard and blown his W first... and even then he'll probably get the kill he swapped in for before he dies.  Hell, he might still get out too by swapping back to his ult shadow!  He's very hard to punish, but he punishes YOU very brutally.  Counterplay or not, that's frustrating.  Talon and Rengar don't really have a comparable escape... or any escape at all sometimes.  They can just click to run away.  If Talon didn't use his ult to go in, he can use it to stealth.... that's about it.

Hell, I thought Zed was better back when his ult put a shadow beside his target instead of leaving an escape route.  Sure, it gave him more burst on his ult, but not having that safety net made his all-ins more punishing if he fucked up.  No idea why Riot changed him, but it's a large part of the reason people find him frustrating.  You have to build specifically to counter him or he'll bone you (which isn't an build against the rest of his team at times) and you know how people hate altering theri cookie-cutter builds.  Even if you build against him it just prevents death... doing nothing to let you kill HIM in return.  People hate Fizz too for the same damned reason.  He's super safe and mobile and frustrating.

All of that said... I DO think Rengar and Talon are bigger problems.  But then, any champ that snowballs off kills and is really hard to keep at bay would be.  Why the hell did Rengar need a free cleanse, Riot?  What the hell were you thinking?!  "CC and kill the assassin when he dives" is the way you are supposed to stop them and protect your carry.  There is no saving a squishy from Rengar. EVER.  That's pretty stupid.

The thing that's different about Zed is that he has such a powerful and non-situational escape. If he's fed, he _is_ killing someone on your team and you _won't_ kill him, not without him making a major misplay. There is no way for you to out run zed to catch him or escape him, he just uses ult and gets to pull off all of his abilities and get away. Even if you CC him right after he kills your ally, he will just teleport away as soon as it wears off, and chances are your highest source of damage is dead already.

Really the only thing that can be done to stop zed is to give the ally he's targeting massive protection.
